titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I received the Holy Communion at 8 a.m. The Precentor was the celebrant. At 11 a.m. I presided at a Chapter Meeting. We had before us the case of Langley House, in which grave & dangerous defects have been disclosed, reflecting the utmost discredit on the contractor who was none other than our pious Dissenting Mayor, Gradon!! I undertook to write to him severely.
lunched here. He is a student, 20 years old, from S

Chad's. He hails from Jersey, & so escapes the Service Act: but he ought to have volunteered. A gentle youth with dreamy eyes: rather restive at the "Catholic" tendencies of the college: & ingenuously enthusiastic over the Cathedral. I gave him a copy of 'Robertson'.
